asset.name: Fazirsiran
asset.one_liner: First therapy addressing root cause of AATD liver disease with 96% Z-AAT reduction

biology.simple_explanation: In Alpha-1 Antitrypsin Deficiency, the mutant Z-AAT protein misfolds and aggregates in hepatocytes instead of being secreted. This accumulation causes liver damage. By silencing AAT mRNA, fazirsiran prevents production of the toxic aggregates.
biology.pathway_detail: The Z mutation (Glu342Lys) causes AAT to misfold in the ER. Instead of being secreted, Z-AAT polymerizes and accumulates in hepatocyte ER, triggering ER stress, autophagy impairment, and eventual cirrhosis.

why_good_target.clinical_validation: No approved therapy for AATD liver disease; only lung disease treated with AAT augmentation
why_good_target.rationale: Silencing stops production at source; aggregates cleared over time

mechanism.how_it_works: Fazirsiran silences AAT mRNA in hepatocytes, reducing production of both normal and mutant Z-AAT protein. With reduced production, existing toxic aggregates are cleared, and liver damage halts or reverses.

lead.name: Alpha-1 Antitrypsin Deficiency Liver Disease (AATD-LD)
lead.patient_population: ~10-15% of AATD patients develop liver disease
lead.rationale: No approved therapy; addresses root cause of liver damage

results.interpretation: Strong target engagement and early efficacy signal

bull_case.point: Addresses root cause of AATD liver disease
bull_case.evidence: 96% Z-AAT reduction with histological fibrosis improvement
AAT augmentation only treats lung disease, not liver
Strong pharma partner with rare disease expertise

bear_case.evidence: ~10-15% of AATD patients develop liver disease
bear_case.counter_argument: Orphan indication with high unmet need

bear_case.evidence: May require clinical outcomes (not just Z-AAT reduction) for approval
bear_case.counter_argument: Histology improvement in Phase 2 suggests pathway

bear_case.evidence: Limited ARWR influence on timing and decisions

key_debates.question: Will Phase 3 SEQUOIA show sufficient fibrosis improvement for FDA approval?
key_debates.bull_view: Phase 2 showed histological improvement; mechanism sound
